emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that automatically adapt to real-time data changes via AI, reducing human oversight needs.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces fraud, increases efficiency, but could lead to job displacement in legal sectors.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on legal framework adjustments, trust in AI, and integration with existing blockchain networks.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Space Operations
emerging_technologies.description: Utilizing blockchain for decentralized governance of space missions, ensuring transparency and stakeholder involvement.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes international cooperation in space, but could lead to regulatory challenges.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires global policy frameworks, technological maturity in space travel, and widespread blockchain adoption.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain-based systems where energy production and consumption are tokenized, enabling peer-to-peer energy trading.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances energy efficiency and decentralization, potentially reducing energy poverty but might complicate market regulations.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on renewable energy adoption, regulatory support, and consumer education.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Interface Identity Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Secure, blockchain-based markets for buying and selling neural data, enhancing privacy and consent in cognitive enhancements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical concerns about data privacy and ownership but could revolutionize personal data control.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires advancements in neural technology, strong data protection laws, and public acceptance of neural data trading.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Transport Networks
mainstream_technologies.description: Fully autonomous transport systems managed through blockchain for routing, payment, and vehicle management.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: High adoption in urban areas due to efficiency and reduced cost, supported by government initiatives for smart cities.

mainstream_technologies.name: Green Energy Certificates
mainstream_technologies.description: Certification of green energy production and consumption via blockchain, ensuring authenticity and traceability.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasingly adopted by businesses for CSR, with significant consumer demand for verifiable green energy sources.

epoch_themes.description: Shift towards systems where control and decision-making are distributed among stakeholders rather than centralized authorities.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes democracy, transparency, but can complicate decision-making processes and enforcement.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rising demand for transparency and accountability in governance, especially in digital and space sectors.

epoch_themes.description: Economies built around the creation, exchange, and use of tokens for various services and goods.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Could democratize access to resources but introduces new economic models that need careful regulation.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing integration of blockchain in financial systems, leading to broader token economy applications.
